title: Curses Pronounced at Mount Ebal
summary: Deuteronomy 27 outlines instructions for setting up stones with the law written on them at Mount Ebal and building an altar. The Levites then pronounce curses for specific sins, reinforcing the seriousness of the law.

faq.question: What was to be written on the stones?
faq.answer: The entire law, clearly and publicly.

faq.question: Why were curses pronounced?
faq.answer: To warn against secret sins and to highlight the consequences of disobedience.
